# `group_nest()`

The popularity of nesting data (i.e. using list-columns) in `R` is clear when we consider it now has a `group_*()` function for it directly in `dplyr`. Nesting, in general, is a technique to organize data, models, meta-data, and more. However, the documentation of using nesting in `data.table` is lacking.
